name: youtarr
description: Youtarr is a self-hosted YouTube request and download manager that coordinates with media servers and Arr tools. Users can request videos, which are then fetched and organized automatically.
features: Request management: Allow users to request YouTube videos for download through a web interface with approval workflows.
Automatic downloads: Fetch requested videos automatically using yt-dlp with configurable quality and format settings.
Media server integration: Organize downloaded content into libraries compatible with Plex, Jellyfin, and Emby.
Channel subscriptions: Monitor YouTube channels and automatically download new uploads based on defined rules.
Quality selection: Choose video resolution, audio bitrate, and container formats per request or globally.
Metadata extraction: Automatically fetch and store video titles, descriptions, thumbnails, and channel information.
Duplicate detection: Prevent downloading the same video multiple times by checking existing library content.
Storage management: Set disk space limits and retention policies to automatically remove old or unwatched content.
User permissions: Control who can request videos, approve downloads, and manage the library with role-based access.
Download queue: View and manage pending downloads with priority ordering and manual intervention options.
Notification system: Send alerts when requested videos are downloaded and ready to watch.
Subtitle support: Automatically download available subtitles and captions in multiple languages alongside videos.
